intro: Boehmeria virgata var. austroqueenslandica, commonly known as the Queensland flax, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family and is characterized by its fibrous, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically pollinated by insects. Its fibers are historically used for making textiles and rope, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
